page.title: 01Ulgham and Tritlington
page.content: Ulgham ancient village in Northumberlnd, pronounced UFFAM Dormitory commuter villae 120 houses sub P.O.stores,craftshop,farms,garden centre,restaurant, Age range to 90. Mainly higher income,employment in local towns,few unemployed but increasing amongst youth. Most have cars, many two. Education, health nd vicr outside. Church weekly,travelling library fortnightly. Active W.I. Village Assn , Cricket club, PCC.Attractive appearance actively maintained. Threatened open cast to north.Tritlington, small village, dominated by Hall Farm, a large concern producing milk, meat and corn. Cockle Park is an agricultural experimental station of Newcastle Uni. Here students are trained and research is into all farming aspects -animal breeding and feeding,crop production,w
